segment.source: Search and Filter the List of GPOs
segment.target: Search and Filter the List of GPOs

segment.source: Search and Filter the List of GPOs
segment.target: Search and Filter the List of GPOs

segment.source: Search and Filter the List of GPOs
segment.target: Search and Filter the List of GPOs

segment.source: In Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM), you can search the list of Group Policy Objects (GPOs) and their attributes to filter the list of GPOs displayed.
segment.target: In Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM), you can search the list of Group Policy Objects (GPOs) and their attributes to filter the list of GPOs displayed.

segment.source: For example, you can search for GPOs with a particular name, state, or comment.
segment.target: For example, you can search for GPOs with a particular name, state, or comment.

segment.source: You can also search for GPOs that were last changed by a particular Group Policy administrator or on a particular date.
segment.target: You can also search for GPOs that were last changed by a particular Group Policy administrator or on a particular date.

segment.source: Performing a complex search
segment.target: Performing a complex search

segment.source: You can perform a complex search by using the format GPO attribute 1: search string 1 GPO attribute 2: search string 2…all-column search strings.
segment.target: You can perform a complex search by using the format GPO attribute 1: search string 1 GPO attribute 2: search string 2…all-column search strings.

segment.source: The search is not case-sensitive.
segment.target: The search is not case-sensitive.

segment.source: GPO attribute: Any column heading in the list of GPOs in AGPM other than Computer Version or User Version.
segment.target: GPO attribute: Any column heading in the list of GPOs in AGPM other than Computer Version or User Version.

segment.source: GPO attributes include the GPO name, state, user who most recently changed the GPO, date and time when the GPO was most recently changed, comment, GPO status, and WMI filter applied to the GPO.
segment.target: GPO attributes include the GPO name, state, user who most recently changed the GPO, date and time when the GPO was most recently changed, comment, GPO status, and WMI filter applied to the GPO.

segment.source: Search string: Text for which to search in the specified column.
segment.target: Search string: Text for which to search in the specified column.

segment.source: If a string includes spaces, you must enclose the string with quotation marks.
segment.target: If a string includes spaces, you must enclose the string with quotation marks.

segment.source: All-column search strings: Text for which to search in all columns in the list of GPOs in AGPM other than Computer Version and User Version.
segment.target: All-column search strings: Text for which to search in all columns in the list of GPOs in AGPM other than Computer Version and User Version.

segment.source: You can include multiple strings separated by spaces.
segment.target: You can include multiple strings separated by spaces.

segment.source: If a string includes spaces, you must enclose the string with quotation marks.
segment.target: If a string includes spaces, you must enclose the string with quotation marks.

segment.source: Each GPO attribute and search string pair and each all-column search string are combined by using a logical AND operation.
segment.target: Each GPO attribute and search string pair and each all-column search string are combined by using a logical AND operation.

segment.source: The result is a list of all GPOs for which each specified attribute includes the specified search string and for which any all-column search strings appear in at least one column.
segment.target: The result is a list of all GPOs for which each specified attribute includes the specified search string and for which any all-column search strings appear in at least one column.

segment.source: The search returns any partial matches for strings so that you can enter part of a GPO name or user name and view a list of all GPOs that include that text in their name.
segment.target: The search returns any partial matches for strings so that you can enter part of a GPO name or user name and view a list of all GPOs that include that text in their name.

segment.source: The following are examples of searches:
segment.target: The following are examples of searches:

segment.source: Description of search result
segment.target: Description of search result

segment.source: Search query
segment.target: Search query

segment.source: All GPOs with names that include the text security and North America.
segment.target: All GPOs with names that include the text security and North America.

segment.source: name:securityname:North America
segment.target: name:securityname:North America

segment.source: All checked out GPOs.
segment.target: All checked out GPOs.

segment.source: state:checked out
segment.target: state:checked out

segment.source: All GPOs most recently changed by the user named Administrator and most recently changed within the previous month.
segment.target: All GPOs most recently changed by the user named Administrator and most recently changed within the previous month.

segment.source: changed by:Administratorchange date:lastmonth
segment.target: changed by:Administratorchange date:lastmonth

segment.source: All GPOs in which the word firewall is included in the most recent comment and in which the word security appears in any column.
segment.target: All GPOs in which the word firewall is included in the most recent comment and in which the word security appears in any column.

segment.source: comment:firewallsecurity
segment.target: comment:firewallsecurity

segment.source: All GPOs that have a status of All Settings Disabled.
segment.target: All GPOs that have a status of All Settings Disabled.

segment.source: gpo status:all
segment.target: gpo status:all

segment.source: All GPOs that have a WMI filter named My WMI Filter applied and that have a status of User Configuration Settings Disabled.
segment.target: All GPOs that have a WMI filter named My WMI Filter applied and that have a status of User Configuration Settings Disabled.

segment.source: wmi filter:My WMI Filtergpo status:user
segment.target: wmi filter:My WMI Filtergpo status:user

segment.source: Specifying dates
segment.target: Specifying dates

segment.source: You can search for GPOs changed on a specific date, at a specific time, or during a span of time by using the same special terms available when you search in Windows.
segment.target: You can search for GPOs changed on a specific date, at a specific time, or during a span of time by using the same special terms available when you search in Windows.

segment.source: If entering a specific date or time, you must use the format that is used in the Change Date column.
segment.target: If entering a specific date or time, you must use the format that is used in the Change Date column.

segment.source: The following are examples of searches of the Change Date column:
segment.target: The following are examples of searches of the Change Date column:

segment.source: You can use the following special terms, which are not case-sensitive, when you search the Change Date column:
segment.target: You can use the following special terms, which are not case-sensitive, when you search the Change Date column:

segment.source: Today
segment.target: Today

segment.source: Yesterday
segment.target: Yesterday

segment.source: ThisWeek
segment.target: ThisWeek

segment.source: LastWeek
segment.target: LastWeek

segment.source: ThisMonth
segment.target: ThisMonth

segment.source: LastMonth
segment.target: LastMonth

segment.source: TwoMonths
segment.target: TwoMonths

segment.source: ThreeMonths
segment.target: ThreeMonths

segment.source: ThisYear
segment.target: ThisYear

segment.source: LastYear
segment.target: LastYear

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be a Reviewer, an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be a Reviewer, an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents permission for the domain.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents permission for the domain.

segment.source: For more information about GPO attributes, see Contents Tab Features.
segment.target: For more information about GPO attributes, see Contents Tab Features.

segment.source: Additional references
segment.target: Additional references

segment.source: Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
segment.target: Advanced Group Policy Management 4.0
